title: Eosinophilic pediatric ABPM lacking fungal sensitization responsive to anti-IL-5.
abstract: A pediatric patient with allergic bronchopulmonary mycosis with high-attenuation mucus and no fungal sensitization achieved remission with anti-IL-5 therapy, highlighting the diagnostic value of high-attenuation mucus and the role of eosinophilic inflammation in non-IgE-dominant airway disease.
